t: For the director of music. Of David.
In*pn the Lord*s I take refuge. How*ld then can you say to me: “Flee*ld like a bird to your mountain.
For*ln look, the wicked bend their bows; they*ld set their arrows against the strings to*ln shoot from the shadows at*ld the upright in heart.
When*ln the foundations are being destroyed, what*ld can the righteous do?”
The*pn Lord*s is in his holy temple; the*ld Lord*s is on his heavenly throne. He*ln observes everyone on earth; his*ld eyes examine them.
The*ln Lord*s examines the righteous, but*ld the wicked, those who love violence, he*ld hates with a passion.
On*ln the wicked he will rain fiery*ld coals and burning sulfur; a*ld scorching wind will be their lot.
For*pn the Lord*s is righteous, he*ld loves justice; the*ld upright will see his face.
